item.title: Macron reappoints Lecornu as French PM after days of turmoil
item.description: SÃ©bastien Lecornu resigned on Monday after 26 days in the job and he said two days later his "mission is over".

item.title: Ceasefire comes into force as Israel's military pulls out of parts of Gaza
item.description: Thousands of displaced Palestinians are making their way to their homes in the north of the territory.

item.title: Major Russian strikes cut power in Kyiv and across Ukraine
item.description: Officials say 380,000 consumers in Kyiv are without power, with emergency outages in place across Ukraine.

item.title: Trump threatens to impose additional 100% tariff on China
item.description: The S&P 500 closed down 2.7%, its steepest fall since April, after the US president hit out at China.

item.title: As Nobel Prize goes to Venezuela's opposition leader, how far would Trump go to help her?
item.description: Maria Corina Machado called on Donald Trump directly to help her country which continues to be at crisis.
